summary: Build a Shopify-like e-commerce platform with full Shopify-style UI/UX and functionality, enabling anyone to create and run an online store (multi-store/multi-seller).
architectural_notes: Platform goal: Shopify-like multi-store e-commerce with role-based access (seller/dropshipper) and storefront + checkout.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Modern minimalist ecommerce logo mark + wordmark, neutral palette with an emerald (or similar non-blue/purple) accent (shop-logo.dim_512x128.png)
- Wide hero banner illustration in a clean ecommerce style (no text), suitable for a homepage hero background (hero-banner.dim_1600x600.png)
- Neutral product placeholder image (simple studio backdrop) (product-placeholder.dim_400x400.png)

existing_features.title: Apply a cohesive, Shopify-like visual design system across the app (Home, Header, Footer, Products, Suppliers, Cart, Checkout, Payment Success/Failure) with consistent spacing, typography, and component styling; use English for all user-facing text.

Choose and enforce ONE distinct visual theme (colors, typography, layout) that is not blue/purple-dominant, and update Tailwind/theme tokens accordingly so the whole UI matches (including gradients currently used in HomePage/Header).

Add a self-serve “Create Store” (seller onboarding) flow so any authenticated user can open a store on the platform by creating/updating their supplier profile (store name, description, contact info).

Implement a seller dashboard that is accessible only to users who have a supplier profile (store created) and provides: store overview, list of their products, and actions to add/update/delete products.

Upgrade the storefront browsing experience to be Shopify-like: improve Products and Suppliers pages with better merchandising UI (filters/sorting remain), and add navigation from Suppliers to a supplier-specific product listing.
Add and use required static generated images under frontend/public/assets/generated, and update UI to use them consistently where appropriate (brand + hero + placeholders).

new_feature_requests.summary: Redesign the site to be Shopify-like (full Shopify-style UI/UX and theme across pages)
Enable anyone to create an online store on the platform (multi-store/multi-seller store creation flow)
Add Product and Add Store sections with role-based access control (initially requested: only dropshippers can access)
Seller/Dropshipper dashboard for managing store and products
Storefront pages that visitors can browse (product listings, product details, etc.)
Checkout flow similar to Shopify (e.g., Stripe integration)

Add backend endpoints needed to support seller dashboard ergonomics without requiring the frontend to pass principals manually (e.g., getCallerSupplierProfile and getCallerSupplierProducts) and wire them into new React Query hooks.

projectName: Redesign app to feel Shopify-like and add self-serve store creation + seller dashboard
